intro: Malcolmia serbica var. pancicii, commonly known as the Serbica mallows, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant features showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions.
